parallel.distributed

Class DLockSrv

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DLockSrv

  • public final class DLockSrv
extends java.lang.Object
    class implements a server for distributed locking functionality. Multiple JVMs can connect to this server and ask for the lock corresponding to this server. Each client may as well be multi-threaded. Each DLockSrv may serve up to 10000 concurrent clients asking for the lock (assuming the O/S can handle this many sockets and threads). If more clients need to get such a global distributed lock, multiple lock servers may connect as clients to a centralized server (forming a star topology). Clients of the distributed global lock may then connect to any of the participating lock servers in the star topology, and in this way millions of clients could be reliably acquiring/releasing a single global lock. In fact, any connected tree that has no cycle in it, will work (if on the other hand there exists a cycle in the servers topology, it is guaranteed that all lock requests will instantly hang.) As the server uses the parallel.FIFOLock class to implement its lock mechanism, there is no way to check whether a thread calling releaseLock() actually had obtained the lock prior to the call. It is the responsibility of the calling code to ensure no thread tries to release the distributed lock without having obtained it first.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2016

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
